conclusion: Analyze the area under the v-t graph to determine displacement.
The v-t graph shows velocity changes over time; area under graph from t=0 to t=3 gives displacement.
From t=0 to t=1 second, velocity is constant at 2 m/s.
From t=1 to t=2 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to -2 m/s.
From t=2 to t=3 seconds, velocity remains constant at -2 m/s.
Calculate area from t=0 to t=1 second: Area = 2 m.
Calculate area from t=1 to t=2 seconds: Area = 2 m.
Calculate area from t=2 to t=3 seconds: Area = -2 m.
Total displacement is 2 m + 2 m - 2 m = 2 m.
Particle has not returned to starting point; it is 2 meters away.
